text: in 1966 I was in the middle school when
the culture of illusion started the
biggest nation on earth
China is in turmoil if China's aging
leader Mao Zedong losing control has now
gone mad driven perhaps to megalomania
by the hysterical adulation of the
teenage red guard
of course I join is a glorious to join
you I was totally a poor my energy even
my life into it to support whatever Mao
asked me to do Mao had decided to
mobilize the young people as the driving
force of a vast campaign to purify the
Communist Party
there was to be a new revolution a
cultural revolution a revolution in
people's thinking we went to Beijing Mao
receive aza
after we arrived we walk out in the
middle of night because in the morning
we are going to walk through a thermal
square to see our great leader he was
excited we saw he was a God inspired by
mouth the Red Guards went wild in their
enthusiasm to keep the revolution alive
they worshiped Mao as their leader and
follow his instructions without question
they consider long hair western style
clothes and communist teachers were the
target of the potato campaign now keep
taught us they have to receive the
reeducation by the worker and peasant my
female teacher I loved she liked to wear
our beauty clothes she care for
appearance there was a criminal
accusation one boy went to her bedroom
and leave so many people she went there
to cut her hair I went there to lay the
hair has been cut already
he was a humidity I couldn't help I
couldn't help
I couldn't rescue her shame on me
after reports of ratings beatings up and
even murder the Red Guard seemed to have
gone too far their leaders have told
them to cool off and go and help with
the harvest the L of 1967 I began to
kind of reflection and I felt that Mao
was not in control of the causal
relation and we lucky live in the
southern China there is a choice to
escape to our Hong Kong I took this a
risk and begin to my free life
I study sociology and later on went to
UC Berkeley for political science in
America I settle with my family children
grandchildren and also my career my
business I'm 17 now now is the Rica
generation 70 I hope that they reflect
the regret that we exam was we prevent
this kind human tragedy happen again
